body:
<!--e57a25ab6845829454e8d69fc972939a-->

The following sections might be updated with supplementary metadata relevant to reviewers and maintainers.

<!--021abf342d371248e50ceaed478a90ca-->
### Reviews
See [the guideline](https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/blob/master/CONTRIBUTING.md#code-review) for information on the review process.
A summary of reviews will appear here.
<!--174a7506f384e20aa4161008e828411d-->
### Conflicts
Reviewers, this pull request conflicts with the following ones:

* [#26625](https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/26625) (test: Run mempool_packages.py with MiniWallet by MarcoFalke)

If you consider this pull request important, please also help to review the conflicting pull requests. Ideally, start with the one that should be merged first.
I have no idea why the CI is failing. The error message is "Unauthorized! Configured service account doesn't have access.".

This may not be unconfirmed. If you need the unconfirmed one from above you can fetch is with `["new_utxo"]`.

Unrelated, I wonder why this needs to be unconfirmed
diff_hunk:
@@ -92,16 +91,12 @@ def run_test(self):
     # the first sequence bit is set.
     def test_disable_flag(self):
         # Create some unconfirmed inputs
-        new_addr = self.nodes[0].getnewaddress()
-        self.nodes[0].sendtoaddress(new_addr, 2) # send 2 BTC
-
-        utxos = self.nodes[0].listunspent(0, 0)
-        assert len(utxos) > 0
+        self.wallet.send_self_transfer(from_node=self.nodes[0])
 
-        utxo = utxos[0]
+        utxo = self.wallet.get_utxo()

body:
Should I change the code to match the origin behavior, which is unconfirmed UTXO?

```diff
diff --git a/test/functional/feature_bip68_sequence.py b/test/functional/feature_bip68_sequence.py
index e53e177ce..e14867dc3 100755
--- a/test/functional/feature_bip68_sequence.py
+++ b/test/functional/feature_bip68_sequence.py
@@ -91,9 +91,7 @@ class BIP68Test(BitcoinTestFramework):
     # the first sequence bit is set.
     def test_disable_flag(self):
         # Create some unconfirmed inputs
-        self.wallet.send_self_transfer(from_node=self.nodes[0])
-
-        utxo = self.wallet.get_utxo()
+        utxo = self.wallet.send_self_transfer(from_node=self.nodes[0])["new_utxo"]
 
         tx1 = CTransaction()
         value = int((utxo["value"] - self.relayfee) * COIN)
```
diff_hunk:
@@ -92,16 +91,12 @@ def run_test(self):
     # the first sequence bit is set.

-

body: Force-pushed with taking suggestion https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/26657#discussion_r1043466273 and remove formatting fixes.

@MarcoFalke  Is calling `gettxout` would affect `UTXOS_IN_CACHE` in `interface_usdt_utxocache.py`?
See https://cirrus-ci.com/task/5276905402793984

If so I have to find another way to ignore spent utxos in Miniwallet rescan_utxos. Or simply increase the `UTXOS_IN_CACHE` in `interface_usdt_utxocache.py`?

```
 test  2022-12-09T05:23:40.698000Z TestFramework.node0 (DEBUG): Node stopped 
 test  2022-12-09T05:23:40.698000Z TestFramework (INFO): handle_utxocache_flush(): UTXOCacheFlush(duration=4414, mode=ALWAYS, size=151, memory=31072, for_prune=False) 
 test  2022-12-09T05:23:40.699000Z TestFramework (INFO): handle_utxocache_flush(): UTXOCacheFlush(duration=4493, mode=ALWAYS, size=0, memory=2080, for_prune=False) 
 test  2022-12-09T05:23:40.733000Z TestFramework (INFO): check that we don't expect additional flushes 
 test  2022-12-09T05:23:40.733000Z TestFramework (ERROR): Assertion failed 
                                   Traceback (most recent call last):
                                     File "/tmp/cirrus-ci-build/ci/scratch/build/bitcoin-x86_64-pc-linux-gnu/test/functional/test_framework/test_framework.py", line 134, in main
                                       self.run_test()
                                     File "/tmp/cirrus-ci-build/ci/scratch/build/bitcoin-x86_64-pc-linux-gnu/test/functional/interface_usdt_utxocache.py", line 151, in run_test
                                       self.test_flush()
                                     File "/tmp/cirrus-ci-build/ci/scratch/build/bitcoin-x86_64-pc-linux-gnu/test/functional/interface_usdt_utxocache.py", line 379, in test_flush
                                       assert_equal(0, len(expected_flushes))
                                     File "/tmp/cirrus-ci-build/ci/scratch/build/bitcoin-x86_64-pc-linux-gnu/test/functional/test_framework/util.py", line 56, in assert_equal
                                       raise AssertionError("not(%s)" % " == ".join(str(arg) for arg in (thing1, thing2) + args))
                                   AssertionError: not(0 == 1)
```

interface_usdt_utxocache.py is failing due to [test: Ignore spent utxos in MiniWallet rescan_utxos](https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/26657/commits/182bea1098b9d683e8698de4dd0a015f2b482338), I'm working on it.

It seems `gettxout` in `MiniWallet.rescan_utxos` calls `GetCoin`, which adds the UTXO to the temporary cache.
Do we have an alternative way to ignore spent utxos in MiniWallet rescan_utxos?

Or, to ensure that the mempool is cleared, could I replace `self.wallet.rescan_utxos()` with `self.generate(self.wallet, 1)`?

```diff
diff --git a/test/functional/feature_bip68_sequence.py b/test/functional/feature_bip68_sequence.py
index 379d04a1f..6030e7138 100755
--- a/test/functional/feature_bip68_sequence.py
+++ b/test/functional/feature_bip68_sequence.py
@@ -212,7 +212,7 @@ class BIP68Test(BitcoinTestFramework):
             else:
                 # This raw transaction should be accepted
                 self.wallet.sendrawtransaction(from_node=self.nodes[0], tx_hex=rawtx)
-                self.wallet.rescan_utxos()
+                self.generate(self.wallet, 1)
                 utxos = self.wallet.get_utxos(include_immature_coinbase=False)

     # Test that sequence locks on unconfirmed inputs must have nSequence
```
Can you explain why? `scantxoutset` doesn't scan the mempool, does it?
diff_hunk:
@@ -124,7 +125,16 @@ def rescan_utxos(self):
         res = self._test_node.scantxoutset(action="start", scanobjects=[self.get_descriptor()])
         assert_equal(True, res['success'])
         for utxo in res['unspents']:
-            self._utxos.append(self._create_utxo(txid=utxo["txid"], vout=utxo["vout"], value=utxo["amount"], height=utxo["height"]))
+            # Ignore utxo inside mempool

body: Without that, the test throw txn-mempool-conflict, and get_utxos indeed return the tx that is inside the mempool.
diff_hunk:
@@ -124,7 +125,16 @@ def rescan_utxos(self):
         res = self._test_node.scantxoutset(action="start", scanobjects=[self.get_descriptor()])
         assert_equal(True, res['success'])
         for utxo in res['unspents']:
-            self._utxos.append(self._create_utxo(txid=utxo["txid"], vout=utxo["vout"], value=utxo["amount"], height=utxo["height"]))
+            # Ignore utxo inside mempool

body: Why is this needed? `wallet.sendrawtransaction` should already account and scan the tx
diff_hunk:
@@ -214,19 +200,20 @@ def test_sequence_lock_confirmed_inputs(self):
                             sequence_value = ((cur_time - orig_time) >> SEQUENCE_LOCKTIME_GRANULARITY)+1
                         sequence_value |= SEQUENCE_LOCKTIME_TYPE_FLAG
                 tx.vin.append(CTxIn(COutPoint(int(utxos[j]["txid"], 16), utxos[j]["vout"]), nSequence=sequence_value))
-                value += utxos[j]["amount"]*COIN
+                value += utxos[j]["value"]*COIN
             # Overestimate the size of the tx - signatures should be less than 120 bytes, and leave 50 for the output
             tx_size = len(tx.serialize().hex())//2 + 120*num_inputs + 50
             tx.vout.append(CTxOut(int(value - self.relayfee * tx_size * COIN / 1000), SCRIPT_W0_SH_OP_TRUE))
-            rawtx = self.nodes[0].signrawtransactionwithwallet(tx.serialize().hex())["hex"]
+            rawtx = self.wallet.signrawtransactionwithwallet(tx=tx)["hex"]
 
             if (using_sequence_locks and not should_pass):
                 # This transaction should be rejected
-                assert_raises_rpc_error(-26, NOT_FINAL_ERROR, self.nodes[0].sendrawtransaction, rawtx)
+                assert_raises_rpc_error(-26, NOT_FINAL_ERROR, self.wallet.sendrawtransaction, from_node=self.nodes[0], tx_hex=rawtx)
             else:
                 # This raw transaction should be accepted
-                self.nodes[0].sendrawtransaction(rawtx)
-                utxos = self.nodes[0].listunspent()
+                self.wallet.sendrawtransaction(from_node=self.nodes[0], tx_hex=rawtx)
+                self.wallet.rescan_utxos()

body:
`utxos = self.wallet.get_utxos()` implies `mark_as_spent=True`, which means `self._utxos` is cleared.
`wallet.sendrawtransaction` only appends the tx to `self._utxos`, so we need `self.wallet.rescan_utxos()` to rescan unspent utxos.

If I remove `utxos = self.wallet.get_utxos()`, the test throw error.

```
2022-12-11T05:34:00.235000Z TestFramework (ERROR): Unexpected exception caught during testing
Traceback (most recent call last):
  File "/bitcoin/test/functional/test_framework/test_framework.py", line 134, in main
    self.run_test()
  File "/bitcoin/./test/functional/feature_bip68_sequence.py", line 73, in run_test
    self.test_sequence_lock_confirmed_inputs()
  File "/bitcoin/./test/functional/feature_bip68_sequence.py", line 202, in test_sequence_lock_confirmed_inputs
    tx.vin.append(CTxIn(COutPoint(int(utxos[j]["txid"], 16), utxos[j]["vout"]), nSequence=sequence_value))
IndexError: list index out of range
```

                         sequence_value |= SEQUENCE_LOCKTIME_TYPE_FLAG
                 tx.vin.append(CTxIn(COutPoint(int(utxos[j]["txid"], 16), utxos[j]["vout"]), nSequence=sequence_value))
-                value += utxos[j]["amount"]*COIN
+                value += utxos[j]["value"]*COIN
             # Overestimate the size of the tx - signatures should be less than 120 bytes, and leave 50 for the output
             tx_size = len(tx.serialize().hex())//2 + 120*num_inputs + 50
             tx.vout.append(CTxOut(int(value - self.relayfee * tx_size * COIN / 1000), SCRIPT_W0_SH_OP_TRUE))
-            rawtx = self.nodes[0].signrawtransactionwithwallet(tx.serialize().hex())["hex"]
+            rawtx = self.wallet.signrawtransactionwithwallet(tx=tx)["hex"]
 
             if (using_sequence_locks and not should_pass):
                 # This transaction should be rejected
-                assert_raises_rpc_error(-26, NOT_FINAL_ERROR, self.nodes[0].sendrawtransaction, rawtx)
+                assert_raises_rpc_error(-26, NOT_FINAL_ERROR, self.wallet.sendrawtransaction, from_node=self.nodes[0], tx_hex=rawtx)
             else:
                 # This raw transaction should be accepted
-                self.nodes[0].sendrawtransaction(rawtx)
-                utxos = self.nodes[0].listunspent()
+                self.wallet.sendrawtransaction(from_node=self.nodes[0], tx_hex=rawtx)
+                self.wallet.rescan_utxos()

body:
Force-pushed with squash commits and replace [test: Ignore spent utxos in MiniWallet rescan_utxos](https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/26657/commits/182bea1098b9d683e8698de4dd0a015f2b482338) with [test: Add "include mempool" flag to MiniWallet rescan_utxos](https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/26657/commits/90b9ab511b6d6b074dee6cabdd20bd42262392be)

```diff
diff --git a/test/functional/test_framework/wallet.py b/test/functional/test_framework/wallet.py                                                                            
index 46b628ee3..52bfb0a2e 100644                                                     
--- a/test/functional/test_framework/wallet.py                                  
+++ b/test/functional/test_framework/wallet.py                                                                                                                                                 
@@ -118,14 +119,13 @@ class MiniWallet:                                               
     def get_balance(self):                                                           
         return sum(u['value'] for u in self._utxos)                                  
                                          
-    def rescan_utxos(self):                                                                                                                                                
+    def rescan_utxos(self, *, include_mempool=True):                                 
         """Drop all utxos and rescan the utxo set"""                                 
         self._utxos = []                                                             
         res = self._test_node.scantxoutset(action="start", scanobjects=[self.get_descriptor()])                                                                            
         assert_equal(True, res['success'])                                           
         for utxo in res['unspents']:                                                 
-            # Ignore utxo inside mempool                                             
-            if not self._test_node.gettxout(txid=utxo["txid"], n=utxo["vout"]):      
+            if not include_mempool and not self._test_node.gettxout(txid=utxo["txid"], n=utxo["vout"]):                                                                    
                 continue                                                                                                                                                   
             self._utxos.append(                                                                                                                                            
                 self._create_utxo(txid=utxo["txid"],                          
```
Any reason for a duplicate method when `sign_tx` already exists?

`sign_tx` only works for `MiniWalletMode.RAW_P2PK`, and the default wallet mode is `MiniWalletMode.ADDRESS_OP_TRUE`, if we change `tx.vin` size we need `signrawtransactionwithwallet` to sign raw transaction on mode `MiniWalletMode.RAW_OP_TRUE` or `MiniWalletMode.ADDRESS_OP_TRUE`.
I mean you could modify sign_tx instead of adding a new method?
Force-pushed with taking suggestion https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/26657#discussion_r1045596497
in 0c20a83fa658fc660b138382d907615b9a60b845: Any reason to duplicate the list of modes, given that it just repeats all modes?
diff_hunk:
@@ -142,20 +142,29 @@ def scan_tx(self, tx):
                 self._utxos.append(self._create_utxo(txid=tx["txid"], vout=out["n"], value=out["value"], height=0))
 
     def sign_tx(self, tx, fixed_length=True):
-        """Sign tx that has been created by MiniWallet in P2PK mode"""
-        assert_equal(self._mode, MiniWalletMode.RAW_P2PK)
-        (sighash, err) = LegacySignatureHash(CScript(self._scriptPubKey), tx, 0, SIGHASH_ALL)
-        assert err is None
-        # for exact fee calculation, create only signatures with fixed size by default (>49.89% probability):
-        # 65 bytes: high-R val (33 bytes) + low-S val (32 bytes)
-        # with the DER header/skeleton data of 6 bytes added, this leads to a target size of 71 bytes
-        der_sig = b''
-        while not len(der_sig) == 71:
-            der_sig = self._priv_key.sign_ecdsa(sighash)
-            if not fixed_length:
-                break
-        tx.vin[0].scriptSig = CScript([der_sig + bytes(bytearray([SIGHASH_ALL]))])
-        tx.rehash()
+        """Sign tx that has been created by MiniWallet in P2TR/RAWSCRIPT/P2PK mode"""

body: This just seems to exclude utxos if they are spent in mempool transactions. Shouldn't it also include utxos if they are created in mempool transactions?
diff_hunk:
@@ -119,12 +119,14 @@ def _bulk_tx(self, tx, target_weight):
     def get_balance(self):
         return sum(u['value'] for u in self._utxos)
 
-    def rescan_utxos(self):
+    def rescan_utxos(self, *, include_mempool=True):
         """Drop all utxos and rescan the utxo set"""
         self._utxos = []
         res = self._test_node.scantxoutset(action="start", scanobjects=[self.get_descriptor()])
         assert_equal(True, res['success'])
         for utxo in res['unspents']:
+            if not include_mempool and not self._test_node.gettxout(txid=utxo["txid"], n=utxo["vout"]):

body: Should I remove the comment or replace it with "Sign tx that has been created by MiniWallet"?
diff_hunk:
@@ -142,20 +142,29 @@ def scan_tx(self, tx):
                 self._utxos.append(self._create_utxo(txid=tx["txid"], vout=out["n"], value=out["value"], height=0))
 
     def sign_tx(self, tx, fixed_length=True):
-        """Sign tx that has been created by MiniWallet in P2PK mode"""
-        assert_equal(self._mode, MiniWalletMode.RAW_P2PK)
-        (sighash, err) = LegacySignatureHash(CScript(self._scriptPubKey), tx, 0, SIGHASH_ALL)
-        assert err is None
-        # for exact fee calculation, create only signatures with fixed size by default (>49.89% probability):
-        # 65 bytes: high-R val (33 bytes) + low-S val (32 bytes)
-        # with the DER header/skeleton data of 6 bytes added, this leads to a target size of 71 bytes
-        der_sig = b''
-        while not len(der_sig) == 71:
-            der_sig = self._priv_key.sign_ecdsa(sighash)
-            if not fixed_length:
-                break
-        tx.vin[0].scriptSig = CScript([der_sig + bytes(bytearray([SIGHASH_ALL]))])
-        tx.rehash()
+        """Sign tx that has been created by MiniWallet in P2TR/RAWSCRIPT/P2PK mode"""

body: It is just a nit. You ignore it or can do whatever you feel most appropriate. Personally I think it is self-explanatory that a method named `MiniWallet::sign_tx` signs a transaction by MiniWallet, so it can be removed. Though "Sign tx that has been created by MiniWallet" is also fine.
diff_hunk:
@@ -142,20 +142,29 @@ def scan_tx(self, tx):
                 self._utxos.append(self._create_utxo(txid=tx["txid"], vout=out["n"], value=out["value"], height=0))
 
     def sign_tx(self, tx, fixed_length=True):
-        """Sign tx that has been created by MiniWallet in P2PK mode"""
-        assert_equal(self._mode, MiniWalletMode.RAW_P2PK)
-        (sighash, err) = LegacySignatureHash(CScript(self._scriptPubKey), tx, 0, SIGHASH_ALL)
-        assert err is None
-        # for exact fee calculation, create only signatures with fixed size by default (>49.89% probability):
-        # 65 bytes: high-R val (33 bytes) + low-S val (32 bytes)
-        # with the DER header/skeleton data of 6 bytes added, this leads to a target size of 71 bytes
-        der_sig = b''
-        while not len(der_sig) == 71:
-            der_sig = self._priv_key.sign_ecdsa(sighash)
-            if not fixed_length:
-                break
-        tx.vin[0].scriptSig = CScript([der_sig + bytes(bytearray([SIGHASH_ALL]))])
-        tx.rehash()
+        """Sign tx that has been created by MiniWallet in P2TR/RAWSCRIPT/P2PK mode"""

body: [test_sequence_lock_confirmed_inputs](https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/blob/69f0f6bc5ec9177cde7fdd0e73dac470f5641f82/test/functional/feature_bip68_sequence.py#L146-L156) would choose a random number of utxos from get_utxos, and if I included the transaction that is inside the mempool, the txn-mempool-conflict would occur.
diff_hunk:
@@ -119,12 +119,14 @@ def _bulk_tx(self, tx, target_weight):
     def get_balance(self):
         return sum(u['value'] for u in self._utxos)
 
-    def rescan_utxos(self):
+    def rescan_utxos(self, *, include_mempool=True):
         """Drop all utxos and rescan the utxo set"""
         self._utxos = []
         res = self._test_node.scantxoutset(action="start", scanobjects=[self.get_descriptor()])
         assert_equal(True, res['success'])
         for utxo in res['unspents']:
+            if not include_mempool and not self._test_node.gettxout(txid=utxo["txid"], n=utxo["vout"]):

body:
I mean that someone setting the bool on the method would expect that this includes utxos created in the mempool. Also, I fail to see how including utxos created in the mempool can cause a conflict, as long as you remove utxos spent in the mempool.

This was also the behavior previously without MiniWallet, so it seems better to keep it, no?

Might be possible by calling scan_tx on all mempool txs, assuming they are topologically sorted.

         """Drop all utxos and rescan the utxo set"""
         self._utxos = []
         res = self._test_node.scantxoutset(action="start", scanobjects=[self.get_descriptor()])
         assert_equal(True, res['success'])
         for utxo in res['unspents']:
+            if not include_mempool and not self._test_node.gettxout(txid=utxo["txid"], n=utxo["vout"]):

body: `getrawmempool` returns only the `transactionid` but not the `tx.vin`, which is required to scan spent UTXOs.

         return sum(u['value'] for u in self._utxos)
 
-    def rescan_utxos(self):

body:
> I mean that someone setting the bool on the method would expect that this includes utxos created in the mempool. Also, I fail to see how including utxos created in the mempool can cause a conflict, as long as you remove utxos spent in the mempool.
> 
> This was also the behavior previously without MiniWallet, so it seems better to keep it, no?
> 
> Might be possible by calling scan_tx on all mempool txs, assuming they are topologically sorted.

To summarize, keep the origin `scan_tx` behavior and, if necessary, remove UTXOs spent in mempool by the caller?

         assert_equal(True, res['success'])

body: `getrawmempool` can return the transaction hex-encoded. You can decode it, or you may be able to call `getmempoolentry` if you need it decoded.
diff_hunk:
@@ -119,12 +119,14 @@ def _bulk_tx(self, tx, target_weight):
     def get_balance(self):
         return sum(u['value'] for u in self._utxos)
 
-    def rescan_utxos(self):
+    def rescan_utxos(self, *, include_mempool=True):
         """Drop all utxos and rescan the utxo set"""
         self._utxos = []
         res = self._test_node.scantxoutset(action="start", scanobjects=[self.get_descriptor()])
         assert_equal(True, res['success'])
         for utxo in res['unspents']:
+            if not include_mempool and not self._test_node.gettxout(txid=utxo["txid"], n=utxo["vout"]):

body: I'll see what I can do tomorrow morning, thanks!

body:
Ah, sorry. You can decode the full raw hex in python or with the `decoderawtransaction` RPC.

Unrelated: Maybe it could make sense to introduce a verbosity=3 to getrawmempool(entry)? But this is unrelated and can be done in a separate pull.

body: Sorry to bother you, but neither `getrawmempool` nor `getmempoolentry` return full raw hex.
